expression_tissue.text: The Expression Tissue section provides information on the expression of a gene in tissues.
expression_tissue.title: Expression Tissue

disease.text: The Disease section provides the information on the disease that the protein is associated with.
disease.title: Disease

synthesized_glycans.text: The Synthesized Glycans section provides a list of glycans that are biosynthesized by the protein. Biosynthetic enzymes are involved in metabolism pathways that convert and modify simple compounds to complex compounds and macromolecules.
synthesized_glycans.title: Synthesized Glycans

goannotation.text: The GO Annotation section provides Gene Ontology (GO) terms associated with the protein that fall into three categories: Molecular Function, Cellular Component, and Biological Processes.
goannotation.title: GO Annotations

homologs.text: The Homologs section contains homologs of the protein/gene in other organisms. The Show Sequence and Alignment buttons display the protein sequence and alignment of the homologous proteins.
homologs.title: Homologs

glycosylation.text: The Glycosylation section provides a detailed list of glycosylation sites, reported glycans attached to the protein, predicted sites and sites text mined from publications.
glycosylation.title: Glycosylation

isoforms.text: The Isoforms section contains a list of isoforms of the protein. The Show Sequences button displays the protein sequence of the isoform.
isoforms.title: Isoforms

history.text: The History section provides information about the release in which the accession was introduced, whether it was mapped from other accessions, and any other information regarding the existence of the protein in GlyGen.
history.title: History

mutagenesis.text: The Mutagenesis section describes the experimental change in amino acid and position and the effect(s) of the mutation on the biological function of the protein, cell or complete organism.
mutagenesis.title: Mutagenesis

biomarkers.text: The Biomarkers section contains biomarkers that involve the protein.
biomarkers.title: Biomarkers

expression_disease.text: The Expression Disease section provides information on the differential expression of a gene for a given disease.
expression_disease.title: Expression Disease

glycation.text: The Glycation section provides a detailed list of sites with non-enzymatic, covalently linked glycans, including the type of attachment and the location on the amino acid sequence.
glycation.title: Glycation

general.text: The General section provides identifying information about the protein from reference databases and sources.
general.title: General

sequence.text: The Sequence section displays the canonical protein sequence and offers highlighting of certain annotations such as N-linked sites, sequon, phosphorylation, etc. when the annotation is selected.
sequence.title: Sequence

function.text: The Function section lists information about the biological function of the protein.
function.title: Function

ptmannotation.text: The PTM section describes post-translational modifications (PTMs) and provides more context and description about the PTMs occurring on the protein.
ptmannotation.title: PTM Annotation

pathway.text: The Pathway section contains pathway information for the protein.
pathway.title: Pathway

snv.text: The Single Nucleotide Variation (SNV) section provides information on disease and non-disease associated mutations. These are most commonly nonsynonymous mutations which cause a different amino acid to be produced at a given position.
snv.title: Single Nucleotide Variation

proannotation.text: The Proteoform Annotation section contains the description of the proteoform(s)/glycoform(s) of the given protein.
proannotation.title: Proteoform Annotation

cross_references.text: The Cross References section provides a list of database entries and links for the protein in other databases.
cross_references.title: Cross References

phosphorylation.text: The Phosphorylation section provides a detailed list of phosphorylation sites and kinase proteins responsible for phosphorylation.
phosphorylation.title: Phosphorylation

names_synonyms.text: The Names section provides information about the protein and gene name(s) and synonym(s).
names_synonyms.title: Names

glycan_ligands.text: The Glycan Ligands section provides a list of glycans that are recognized and bound by the protein and involved in glycan–protein interactions.
glycan_ligands.title: Glycan Ligands

publications.text: The Publications section contains publications where the given protein was mentioned. The publication information comes from multiple data sources that annotate the protein.
publications.title: Publications

viewer.text: This section provides a 3D view of Protein.
viewer.title: 3D View
